reviewText: I absolutely LOVE the Hellsing Ultimate series. Unlike the regular Hellsing anime, this revamp follows the manga. I love the plot. It drew me in and won't let go, although I can't really say I want to be let go of. Basically the daughter of Van Hellsing, her servant Alucard, his servant Seras Victoria, the butler Walter, Mercenaries, and a host of other people, fight rouge vampires and ghouls in England. There is a lot of blood, fighting, shooting, decapitation, and other forms of violence. Unlike a lot of vampire anime's, this one starts off with a bang and the action never stops. I can't wait for the conclusion, Volumes 9 & 10, to come out on Blu-ray/ DVD combo. Ive watched them with subtitles and I loved it. My only gripe: I think Crispin Freeman's voice is better suited to the character Alucard. As well as the other characters. The setting is England, but the Japanese voices have no English accent. This holds true for the German accents as well. It kind of throws the concept.If I had to compare it to anything, it'd be Baccano, because of the violence, but honestly the Hellsing series', (both Hellsing and Hellsing Ultimate), are so far beyond that. It's beyond anything. The Hellsing Ultimate series is on a level of it own, and I love it.

Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: I watched the original years ago and drunkenly cheered gallons of blood spraying the halls of Hellsing Manor. Even so, I was put off by the segments of lazy animation, including still-frames and other directors' tricks to dodge having to actually draw the episodes. (However, they saved their artists for the battles and gore, which I can appreciate.) The ending was stale and had little character growth. I've seen the son of Dracula/King of Vamps bit played to death by anime alone, and expected to find "releasing-access-restriction-level-I'm-unbeatable-so-who-gives-a-s***" sufficient storytelling. It was fan service with some cool characters, but had zero replay value aside from gore worship (which I can get behind).Round Two! Here's their chance to fix the flaws and build this into something real.They do. Let's break it down:***PROS***ANIMATION/ACTIONBig improvement on the original. They still tried to sell me some still-frames (prettier ones, though). The gore volume got turned up a ton, and I was cheering for the splatter-fest. It was the only thing that worked in the original, and they gave more of it. Bravo!CHARACTER DESIGNSMemorable and very cool looking. I can watch Alucard and the Butler melt guys all day. As far as depth, there was none before. Now? Well . . . at least there's some. Thanks again for the improvement, gentlemen. How much of a borderline, uncontrollable menace to all life is Alucard? I want to know. They skipped through some painful crawling of character development with Alucard's sidekick. (Still don't remember her name, but who the hell is supposed to with other characters outshining her in every way?)DISCARDING THE BADThey cruise right past all of the crap that didn't work in the original, while keeping the moments that did. This is total fan service and it looks like they've figured that out.***CONS***EXPECTATIONSWhen they reworked Full Metal Alchemist and Evangelion, the animation quality shot up, making them events instead of shows. Here, there is considerable improvement on the original, but it's still covered in animation gimmicks, lazy stills, and three-frame movements. The gap is huge. It's either gorgeous gore or head-shaking shortcuts. I still thank them for the gorgeous gore, but for a reworked project, this is less than I expected in quality.STORYThere's barely anything beyond, "Welcome to Hellsing, I'm a cool vampire. Bad guys, get ready to die hard." I'm fine with letting a show kick ass and do nothing else, but it drags after a bit. My brain ends up asking for more than two-dimensional motivations, fan service, and characters floating in limbo in terms of development.All in all, if you're ready for a blood shower and to say, "Holy s***! That guy's awesome!," then mount up. If you found the original a masterpiece, then you'll love this. It's a fun ride, but that is all. If part two delivers something different, then this could really turn into something. But I have a feeling that this show will suffer from Decapitation Syndrome (wherein a show destroys itself near the end, running around like a headless chicken). Here's to a better product in part two! I always applaud improvement.I really love anime when it works. I'm an animator and writer myself, so I'm always pouring through the stacks looking for gems. I'll be doing many more reviews. If you find that these are helpful or our tastes seem to align, follow along. I'll try not to steer you into s***.
summary: Hellsing's Second Chance to Be More

reviewText: First off, when looking to purchase this please make sure you are looking for ULTIMATE - not the original Hellsing series. I'd hate for someone to get what they aren't looking for =/This is a pretty standard dvd/blu-ray collection. Over all i really like how it looks - it has a cardboard cover that slides off and looks pretty good. The art work on the set is detailed and clean, and i gotta admit, looks pretty awesome. The discs are of simple design and clearly labled as either 'dvd' or 'blu-ray'. This set comes with the first four installments in the Hellsing Ultimate series, which sounds kind of crappy for the price until you realise that each episode is 45-60 minutes long. So far i've enjoyed the voice acting. The blu rays are clear and crisp.The only problem and the only reason this item is getting a 3 star review is that the dvd picture quality blows. I've tried them on 2 different t.v.'s- one hd, the other an old school big body. It just doesn't seem to be as clear as it should be. If that isn't an issue for you, then this set is worth the cash.
summary: This review is for the actual product - not the content of the series.

Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: Very high quality OVA adaption of the Hellsing manga, production values and consistent art really shine through.  The Blu-ray picture quality is excellent, the line art is bold and sharp w/ no soft upscaling like some.  I had seen the original older anime some years ago so it was nice to revisit this collection when the prices hit $20 last July.  Grim, bloody and gruesome the story has an ancient order of knights loosing a slumbering super-weapon Arucard to fend off newer, lesser vampires from creating their army of ghouls.. and then proceeding to battle everyone's favorite historical villainous fascists.  I liked the overall tone of the anime, though the descent into the child-like art when Seras would get upset was sometimes disconcerting and broke the mood.  Will take in the 5-8 Blu-ray shortly to finish off the series.  Recommended.
summary: Gorgeous blu-ray picture quality and palette in this gruesome vampire anime
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: This is something to watch when you're in the mood for a pure out and out blood and guts fest. And given the two volumes that have come out so far, this is the tame one!The visuals are sharp with bold colors and smooth lines. The bluray quality is superb and you can easily find yourself sucked into the story. The color contrast is well done and makes it easy to follow the sometimes chaotic pace  (that's a good thing) of the story.I think the most amazing part of this particular volume is easily the sound quality. While I find the second set (5-8) has better visual quality (in terms of colors and details) the sound quality on this set is amazing. The song the vampiress sings in episode 4 is so sharp it's like being in a concert hall. I've had to replay that song alone several times just because it is so well sung. Absolutely amazing.If you haven't seen Hellsing Ultimate, read a review of the story and check it out. It's great but I'll freely admit it's not for everyone. This volume could even be considered tame compared to the second set, so know what you are getting into before you buy. This is a very, VERY, bloody anime not only takes the gore up a notch, it completely obliterates the scale in terms of animated violence.

reviewText: The night is dark and silent as Integra Hellsing crawls through the empty air ducts of her family estate, desperately clawing her way blindly to escape the murderous intent of her uncle as he calls to her lovingly, stroking the side of a silver pistol. With nowhere else to run, she flees to the deepest crypts underneath the mansion, seeking some hope of salvation... and what she finds is a desiccated corpse bound and chained in the inner sanctum, flowing mats of black hair covering the dark and empty eye sockets.Footsteps approach, Integra screams, a gun fires, and blood sprays from her body, covering the dusted floor and the grime-caked walls... and the lifeless hanging corpse. Staring down the barrel of her uncle's gun, the young heir accepts her fate--but before death can be dealt, a strange slurping sound slicks about the chamber and the darkened form rises from its bonds and licks at the reddened pools, laughing cruelly as the uncle's eyes widen in shock.Alucard has awoken.In 2001, Gonzo Studios released an anime series based on the popular Hellsing manga that ran for thirteen episodes and strayed drastically from its source material--although the show was a financial success, fans were quick to show their ire... and the series is largely considered a disappointment. In 2006 however, Satelight and Geneon decided to resurrect the narrative and began producing an OVA adaptation that faithfully followed the manga and spanned ten hour-length episodes. The result was Hellsing Ultimate--and it is, by nearly all accounts, a far superior series.There is a very good reason, however, why Hellsing Ultimate has taken over six years to finish--this is one of the most gorgeous anime series I have ever seen. The word "lavish" does not even begin to describe the treat that your eyes will be witness to while watching this show... every fold of every cape, every piece of every background, and all the engravings on every pistol is meticulously detailed and beautifully animated. Hellsing Ultimate is cocaine for your eyes... and for your ears as well.I do not know why any sane English-speaking human being would ever forgo watching the English dub of this series for the Japanese language track. I have previewed the Japanese voice cast, and I can agree that they all deliver quality routines as well, but the performances of Crispin Freeman as Alucard and Gildard Jackson as the Major are utterly spellbinding in their devious passion, breathing life into every aspect of their characters and sating our appetite for spectacle. In addition, many of the characters enjoy well-executed British,German and Irish accents that gives an even further polish to the dub.If there is anything at all lacking in Hellsing Ultimate it would likely be the story: this genre has been done endless times before and many of the tropes are hopelessly tired and clichéd. None of this necessarily hurts the series, however, since this show focuses mostly on the spectacle and continuously breathes new life into every facet taken from antiquity.The vampire Alucard is presented far more monstrous and sinister than any previously notable incarnation--he relishes his existence as a vampire and the boundless heaps of corpses (human or inhuman) that he leaves in his wake. Alucard's lust for bloodshed is utterly intoxicating, and his relationships with other characters is colored by this fact... the only reason that he works for Integra Hellsing is because she provides him with hordes of other vampires to slay, and the only reason he prefers killing vampires is because they are far more fun to kill than whimpering humans. His thirst for bloodshed both repulses Integra and provides her with a nigh unbeatable weapon to wage her war--and the fact that she always need turn to a vampire to slay other vampires continues to wear on her spirit and laden her with a heavy weight of fear and guilt. How long will she be able to control her pet monster... or perhaps more aptly, is she even controlling him at all? The more the series progresses, the more we wonder who is the master and who is the slave.In similar terms, the Major is the main antagonist of the series and commands endless hordes of vampires and an army of the undead for one simple reason: he really, really loves war. The very thought of murder, torture and massacre seems to feed and energize him, and one of the best moments of the whole series is a running monologue depicting his utter obsession. On the one hand, the Major is not a terribly deep character... but his mere presence itself is transfixing in the same manner as the Joker from Batman--he is a source of pure violence and anarchy that threatens to consume the entire world. The thematic value of the character as a symbol (and a powerful one at that) more than makes up his shallowness as an actual person.As an action series with vampires, blood and thrilling violence, Hellsing is an utter masterpiece--gorgeously rendered and masterfully voiced. So long as you are interested in an action thrill-ride, Hellsing Ultimate will more than satisfy your curiosity... and make you expect far more of your vampire fiction in the future.
summary: A lavishly animated spectacle of blood and violence

reviewText: I watch the first Hellsing anime and I liked it, I never complain because I never read the manga of the story so I didn't know the first series didn't follow the real story. Then when I saw this (Hellsing OVA) I thought "Holy crap". In a good way. This anime is like...rated M plus N17 and add any other adult rating you can think of. I mean it has blood and gore to the maximum. If you hate seeing violence, blood or ghouls getting rip to pieces by bullets then you should avoid this anime like the plague. But you have to admit this anime shows you how real fictional vampires act. They are not creatures who sparkle and fall in love with boring, moody teenagers. I don't care what overzealous anime fan says, the dub is amazing no matter what! Each episode gets you anxious just to see what happens next, well for me it does. It sucks they stopped dubbing this and it takes millions and millions of years for the next episode to be aired but it's worth the wait. Also if you get the chance to like Hellsing, then look into The Dawn, it's sort of a prologue to Hellsing.

Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: The anime itself is great, you can read other reviews for that, this is for the special features and presentation.  The collection consists of the first 4 episodes (about 45 minutes a piece), the series has a total of 10.  The animation is much more stylized then the original, and has a humor similar to Fullmetal Alchemist (the original did not).  There are 3 dvds and 2 blu rays that come in the set, and each pair contain the same things.Each episode has a commentary with the english director and one of the voice actors.  There is a good amount of special features including a panel of the voice actors and other members of the show.  The case itself is a regular case with inserts for the extra discs, and a sleeve.As a whole, there is a good amount of extras, about 3 hours of episodes and the packaging is decent.  I would recommend this to any fan of the series (although there are better steel book volumes out there for better packaging, but they're expensive if you're gonna buy them all) or anyone who like a good vampire story.p.s. as of the beginning of 2013, the last two episodes of the series has yet to be released in english dub, so if you want the entire series you will have to wait a bit longer.  Also the second set has a slot to put this collection in there, so the two go well together.

reviewText: I wanted to like this series but I found it very schizophrenic. It tries to be very dark with gallons of blood spilled by even the slightest wound, but then abruptly charges gears (and art styles) into juvenile cutesy-poo humor. Add to the fact you only get four episodes in a huge box set makes this a very poor value.
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: Theres a lot of stigma floating around out there that dubs are basically trash and all "real" anime fans only watch subs. While I dont neccisarily agree with this, I have started to latley feel as though Japanese voice actors are for the most part superior. Not in every anime, but usually the original Japanese voices just seem more natural to me.Hellsing however is the one anime where the english dub absolutley blows the japanese voice cast out of the water. Not that there arent superior english dubs out there, but Hellsing is the only one Ive seen that goes absolutlet uncontested. Crispin Freeman is incredible as Alucard (between him and Morgan people with the last name Freeman just seem to have awesome voices).Steven Brand also did an exellent job as Alexander Anderson. But really I want to praise the whole cast, particularly those who worked with accents and different ethnicities. Whether its British, Itallian, German, french, or Irish, the whole cast handled them very well.As far as the anime itself goes Ill just say that its amazing, Ultimate Hellsing is the standard I hold all anime reboots to now. Its exactly what the fans wanted and what the series deserved. The animeation is incredible, the action scenes are breathtaking, and they actually included a lot fo the comic relief that was left out of the original anime.Shit not only is Ultimate Hellsing better than the original anime, it might be better than the manga. The cast is just that good.Anyway this is a great anime, and five stars just arent enough. And btw this is a great price for a dvd/blu ray combo, especially since anime is usually pretty expensive.
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: I love Hellsing and the re-animated version is closer to the Manga and has a great picture. While the bad guys may seem cliche and Alucard seems OP, I still love this series. If you don't like the it when the Protagonist is over-powered (as many people have claimed) then you probably won't care for this series because Alucard is practically untouchable.

Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: Hellsing Ultimate is a more violent, apparently closer to the Manga, look at the Hellsing franchise. The Hellsing TV series did very well, at least from what I recall in the US, and Geneon was backing Ultimate. Geneon quit the US and in swooped FUNimation to license rescue and finish the Ultimate series. Thank you FUNimation!Video:1080p AVC encoded. I'm not sure that the series was animated originally in HD as a target or if it's simply upsampled, but there are some issues with the video. Gradients are not smooth and there is some softness, along with what looks like an overuse of edge enhancement (haloing) during one of the episodes. It looks better than the original Geneon DVD releases, but there definitely seems to be something odd going on.Disappointing, but not completely horrible.To me, at times, the animation seems a little stilted, not as "animated" as I might like, but overall the quality is good.Audio:English or Japanese DTS 5.1 audio. The Japanese audio is clearer at times, to my ear, than the English version, but overall there  is nothing to complain about at all. They use the surround sound stage constantly, in a good way.Packaging:6 discs in a normal Blu Ray sized case . Artwork looks OK and for a "budget"-ish release it's good. Nothing amazing.Overall:They brought back (though these episodes were already completed) the English dub cast to finish the series. For English language track fans, that's gotta count for something.They included a very nice 5.1 track for both languages. That counts as well.If you like violence and vampires, you probably can't go wrong with Hellsing Ultimate.
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: This show is incredible in every possible aspect. Not only does it give you the first 4 OVAs on Blu Ray, but DVD as well. In all honesty the extra content within is almost irrelevant in the grand scheme of things, however if you're big on bonus features this collection features over 200 minutes worth of bonus features. The show itself is obviously the main attraction. There's a lot of talk about excessive amounts of gore and profanity strewn about the show but in all honesty it adds to the serious and mature presentation of the show. I was a casual fan of the classic Hellsing series when it aired on TV late at night back in the day. Hellsing Ultimate is a reboot that is more true to the manga. In all honesty it completely blows the classic series out of the water. The day this set arrived I watched all 4 episodes in one sitting. I don't want to spoil the plot as my objective is to merely tell you that this is not an OVA you want to pass up. Over the years I've grown out of the 'anime craze.' With so many different ones starting up (some even being cut without being finished) it's just too much to keep up with. I tend to stick with the classics I grew up with. Those that have seen the Full Metal Alchemist: Brotherhood series will have a general understanding of the more modern animation style that is present in Hellsing Ultimate. A few people were asking which series to start with. Truth be told it doesn't really matter as they both have their own beginning and end. I do think most people, myself included would direct any newcomers to the franchise to this particular series as it's the most true to form.This is Hellsing the way it was meant to be seen. These are the first of 10 OVAs (as of this posting V-VIII are available here on Amazon as well). To my knowledge no US release date has been announced for OVAs 9 and 10. Hopefully they'll be out within the year.**EDIT** Feb. 2nd 2013I figured I'd add a bit more after watching the DVD version as well as the core of the special features.First off, the DVD is obviously a step down in quality from the Blu Ray (duh!) That being said it's still hands down one of the best looking Anime DVDs I've ever seen. I'd also like to say that if you're thinking about purchasing this set but don't have access to a Blu Ray player, go ahead and do so. You won't miss out on any content at all and if later on down the line you get a new set up you'll be able to utilize the set's full potential. Again, the DVD looks astounding. I'm not a guru when it comes to the different aspect ratios and what not but I can tell you that after watching I-IV on Blu Ray and then returning to watch it on DVD, I didn't notice anything that seemed to be cut out or missing from any of the scenes. But then again, I'm still a newcomer to the show.Out of sheer laziness I'm not going to list all of the special features. I will say that you do get everything that Amazon has listed in the description. There's actually a label (not shown on Amazon's picture of the item) that says "Over 200 minutes of extra content." That alone should satiate the most rabid of Hellsing fans. Everything from trailers for other Anime series to episode commentaries, it's all there.One more caveat. I know I mentioned before, but the violence should be brought to the attention of any folks planning on picking this up for kids under the age of 18. This show is violent, I mean REALLY violent. Lots of violent mutilation scenes, bodies being mangled and turned into nothing but lumps of swiss cheese from being repeatedly shot, the list goes on. Swearing that is on par with movies like Scarface or any Quentin Tarantino movie. Cartoon wise I guess I could compare the level of violence to that of 'Metalocalypse.' I'm not trying to scare anyone away but I figure that buyers should be weary that this isn't Scooby Doo or even the "Un-cut" versions of Dragon Ball Z and Gundam Wing. This show is in a league of it's own. It never feels overly excessive or 'cheap.' The violence and profanity add to the dark atmosphere of the show.

reviewText: Me and my husband bought Ultimate 1-4 and 5-8 sets. When opening them, pieces of the plastic from the cases came out! Funimation crammed 5 discs into one case each. So 10 discs in 2 blu ray cases was insane! Funimation should of put them out in 4 blu ray cases to avoid this from happening! We had to send back the sets. Amazon sent out a replacement for 1-4 which again we got damaged. And they had to send a refund for 5-8 because right now it's under review by Amazon. Meaning there's something wrong with their sets they got from Funimation. I know as for lately Funimation is trying to cut costs on stuff but this way isn't working! Really need to get your act together Funimation. Hellsing is a excellent series. It's a shame it's getting ruined by horrible cases.
summary: The Worst Blu Ray Cases and Packing!
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: As the box cover states so eloquently, Alucard is a vampire that doesn't ****ing sparkle. A "retelling" of the Hellsing series, the anime starts off in a similar fashion, at least from a storytelling perspective. The similarities quickly evaporate as the three factions (Hellsing, the Catholic Church and the last remnants of the Third Reich) clash in explosive and nearly preposterous battles.The character deaths, special powers and battles are a feast for the eyes (though the sheer quantity of blood could make some fans squeamish). There are more drops of blood than there are inbred children at a Tasmanian barbecue.The English dub is excellent, featuring Laura Bailey (Sana-chan, Honda Tohru) as the viciously sinister yet undeniably cute catboy Schrodinger. Crispin Freeman plays the "tame" vampire working under the auspices of England. The accents are always right on the mark, and the series is never slow or plodding, despite having 50-minute episodes.Now that the final two episodes are finally slated for release later this year, there is no excuse to miss out on this wonderful series. You won't regret it!
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4

reviewText: I read all the Hellsing manga first before I started watching. I was hooked with the very first episode. I'm into dark story lines, supernatural creature features, with some violence on the side. It is amazing. Short. :'( But, was well worth the paid for money for it. It's about a vampire called Alucard who fights with the humans to keep the world in balance from pretty much Hell on earth.
Title: Hellsing Ultimate: Volume 1-4
